stories.text:
Hi HN! I had a joke idea, that morphed into something that might be practical - but I need some help validating the idea. Who here would be interested in the following:

Some people take games seriously and they want to make sure their dice are fair and balanced. I think they would want certified fair dice. Certifican could be accompanied by a video showing 1000 (or 10k or whatever) roles and statistical summary that all numbers are equally likely.

The rolls could be done via Robot, and unfair dice could be sold via as "normal" dice under a different brand to recoup cost or recycled.
stories.title: Ask HN: Market Demand for Balanced Dice
Roman slaveowners were the first management theorists
Ice Spikes: Strange things you can find in your freezer
MPR's Traffic Updates Include Bike Commuter Info Thanks to Pedaling Pastor

stories.text:
I'm a business analyst doing all data work for some middle man company. Atm, I feel overwhelmed, one email after the other, demanding me to finish all the reports (all still in dev. stage for this new program). Sometimes I just stare at the screen, I couldn't even start anything. And then there's constant distraction (Ms teams, more emails...).

I got assigned to this new program where I have to build all the reports from scratch. I do like building and creating but it just got to a point when it feels overwhelming.

When I found out someone else is going to revamp everything that I created for the old program I was handling, I felt even more demotivated. No wonder I couldn't even finish anything now.

I was promised of promotion and wage increase this quarter but now I feel like I wont be getting it as I cannot fulfill the demands anymore.
stories.title: How do I stop feeling overwhelmed at work?

Ezra Klein Says That Trust Is the Key to Effective Covid Policies
